intro: Isoetes tuckermanii subsp. tuckermanii, commonly known as the Tuckerman's quillwort, is a species of aquatic plant belonging to the order Sphenopsida. It is characterized by its dense, spore-bearing structures called strobils, which are typically found at the base of the plant. The plant has a rosette-like arrangement of leaves that are often spirally twisted, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in freshwater environments such as ponds and marshes, where it plays a role in aquatic ecosystems. Its morphology and reproductive structures are well-adapted to its submersed or emergent habitat.
